raw_text:
US show sued for rat-eating stunt
 
 A US TV network is being sued for $2.5m (£1.3m) by a viewer who says he was disgusted by watching contestants eat dead rats in a stunt show.
 
 Austin Aitken is taking action against NBC over its programme Fear Factor. He said watching the show caused his blood pressure to rise so high that he became dizzy and light-headed. The legal assistant said NBC was "sending the wrong message to viewers that cash can make or have people do just about anything beyond reasoning". The hand-written, four-page lawsuit said: "To have the individuals on the show eat and drink dead rats was crazy and from a viewer's point of view made me throw-up as well as another in the house at the same time." Mr Aitken, who lives in Cleveland, said that after becoming light-headed, he ran towards the bedroom and knocked his head in a doorway. A spokesman for NBC said it had no comment on the lawsuit, but confirmed the stunt show did feature a rat-eating scene in New York's Times Square on 8 November. Past shows have featured viewers eating spiders and live worms. The programme has been screened in the UK on Sky One.
llama3.2:1b: A US TV network is being sued for $2.5m (£1.3m) by a viewer who claimed they were disgusted by watching contestants eat dead rats in a stunt show, causing their blood pressure to rise and making them dizzy and light-headed.
The lawsuit also claims the network was sending a wrong message to viewers about the risks of extreme activities.

The lawsuit argues this sends a wrong message about morality and human limits.
The show has featured other controversial stunts like viewers consuming spiders and live worms as well.

A spokesman for NBC confirmed the Times Square scene but had no comment on the lawsuit.
Past shows featured other extreme eating challenges like spiders and live worms; the program is screened in the UK.

stablelm2:1.6b: US TV network NBC is facing a $2.5m lawsuit from viewer Austin Aitken after showing contestants eating dead rats in the show Fear Factor, according to Aitken who lives in Cleveland.

granite3.1-dense:2b: A US resident, Austin Aitken, is suing NBC for $2.5m over the reality TV show Fear Factor, which aired a rat-eating challenge in New York's Times Square on 8 November.
Aitken claims the stunt caused severe physical reactions, including dizziness and a near-concussion after knocking his head in a doorway while feeling light-headed.
He argues that NBC is sending an irresponsible message to viewers about the value of money and the willingness to do outrageous acts.
The lawsuit highlights past Fear Factor segments involving contestants eating spiders and live worms, and mentions that the show has also aired in the UK on Sky One.
NBC has no comment on the lawsuit but acknowledges the rat-eating incident occurred as described by Aitken.
